title: What Time Is It? Global Banking

sections.title: Time in the Bank
sections.content:
Being punctual is important for meetings and transactions.

- **What time is it?**: ¿Qué hora es?
- **O'clock**: En punto (e.g., 9:00 - nine o'clock)
- **Half past**: Y media (e.g., 9:30 - half past nine)
- **Quarter past**: Y cuarto
- **Quarter to**: Menos cuarto
- **AM / PM**: Mañana / Tarde-Noche
- **Noon**: Mediodía

sections.title: Modern Banking: Time Zones
sections.content:
Digital banking is global. We need to know different **Time Zones**.

- **Time Zone**: Zona horaria
- **London Time**: Hora de Londres
- **Local Time**: Hora local
- **World Clock**: Reloj mundial

### Global Example
```mermaid
graph LR
    A[London: 9:00 AM] -- +1 hour --> B[Madrid: 10:00 AM]
    A -- -5 hours --> C[New York: 4:00 AM]
```

sections.title: Grammar: Present Simple Negative
sections.content:
To say something does not happen, we use **don't** or **doesn't**.

**Structure (I/You/We/They + don't + verb):**
- I **don't work** on Saturdays.
- We **don't open** at midnight.

**Structure (He/She/It + doesn't + verb):**
- The bank **doesn't close** at noon.
- The app **doesn't stop** at night.
